contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{CountryLink Station alt|station_name=<big>Queanbeyan</big>|image=Queanbeyan Railway Station (02).jpg|servicearea=CountryLink Southern|servicearea_color=#009900|servicearea_textcolor=white|code=QBN|town=Queanbeyan|street=Henderson Street|distance=321.460|altitude=?|traintype=[[CountryLink]]|platforms=1|tracks=2|platform_arr=1 Side|stationtype=Ground|connect=Bus|disabled=Yes}} [[Image:Queanbeyan_railway_station.jpg|250px|thumb|right|The roadside view of the station]] '''Queanbeyan''' is a railway station located on the border of Queanbeyan, [[New South Wales]] and Oaks Estate, [[Australian Capital Territory]], [[Australia]] on [[Countrylink|CountryLink's]] [[Canberra]] Line. The station has a single platform capable of accommodating approximately 6 Xplorer cars. As the railway line is the border between the ACT and NSW, the station is in New South Wales, while the land opposite the railway line is in the ACT. The main station building was completed in March 1887.<ref>'''''Queanbeyan Station Building - A Whitton Legacy''''' Sharp, Stuart [[Australian Railway History|Australian Railway Historical Society Bulletin]], March 2000 pp94-98</ref> Queanbeyan is serviced twice daily by CountryLink's Sydney to Canberra Xplorer service. The station is also home to the [[Australian Railway Historical Society]] ACT Division tours office and a [[CountryLink]] booking office. == See also == *[[Queanbeyan, New South Wales]] == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category inline|Queanbeyan Railway Station}} {{s-rail-start|noclear=yes}} {{s-rail|title=CountryLink}} {{s-line|system=CountryLink|line=Southern|branch=Canberra Xplorer|previous=Canberra|next=Bungendore}} {{end}} {{coord|-35.3429|149.2276|format=dms|type:railwaystation_region:AU-NSW|display=title}} [[Category:Regional railway stations in New South Wales]] {{NewSouthWales-rail-transport-stub}}
